summary: Jane Lind Downey was an employee of the U.S. House of Representatives Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA). She is listed in multiple payroll and certification reports from 1978 and 1979. These documents detail her position, annual salary, and pay period earnings during her time with the committee. The reports span from May 1978 to February 1979, indicating her period of employment with the HSCA.
significance: Jane Lind Downey's significance lies in her employment with the HSCA, which was tasked with investigating the assassination of President John F. Kennedy. While the specific nature of her role is not detailed in the provided summaries, her presence on the payroll indicates her involvement in the committee's operations during its investigation.
